thread.title: How Figure Skating Fell Hard for ‘Moulin Rouge!’ - WSJ

author: Louise Radnofsky
title: How Figure Skating Fell Hard for ‘Moulin Rouge!’ - WSJ
text:
GANGNEUNG, South Korea—Vincent Zhou was in a hurry. When the American figure skater scrapped his long program right before this season, he knew he needed new music, and he knew it needed to be good enough to carry him in an Olympic year. He experimented with several pieces in the canon of skating music before he found the one that felt right. 

It was a medley of “Nature Boy” and “Your Song” from the soundtrack of “Moulin Rouge!,” from the soundtrack of “Moulin Rouge!,” the 2001 Baz Luhrmann movie musical set in the famous... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
